report_title: Industry Report on Axe Throwing Centers
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. A rise in time spent on leisure activities is driving consumers toward recreational services like axe throwing centers. Axe throwing center providers are part of a larger industry group with more than one hundred indoor and outdoor entertainment, recreation, amusement, camp and club services. Consumer recreational expenditures declined and shifted to local outdoor recreation or in-home entertainment during the COVID-19 pandemic. But since the pandemic revenue has been growing as national popularity of axe throwing keeps growing.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The effects of the COVID-19 pandemic slashed industry growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: To adhere to health and safety regulations, axe throwing centers were forced to close entertainment complexes, hence resulting in a sharp contraction of revenue. COVID-19 also impacted consumers' fiscal flexibility. This is exemplified by sharp declines in per capita expenditure on alcohol and the Consumer Confidence Index, two metrics which are crucial barometers for success in the industry.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Increases in per capita disposable income helped push revenue up
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Increases in per capita disposable income helped push revenue up after the COVID-19 pandemic slashed customer demand. The unemployment rate rally spurs a positive outlook among customers and increased recreational spending, securing profit for battered companies.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The uptick in social sharing platforms guides marketing efforts
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The uptick in social sharing platforms guides family entertainment centers in marketing efforts as younger adults and older individuals share their experiences. This helps explain the ever-increasing popularity of axe throwing as a recreational activity for people.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Pricing will influence how consumers spend limited recreation dollars
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Total recreation expenditure is expected to keep growing over the next five years. But, as the cost-of-living crisis continues, many people will be weary of spending their money on a night out and will become more selective on where they go. The cost-of-living crisis will pressure companies like axe throwing centers to reduce prices to maintain healthy customer demand and profit.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Growth of the industry will continue to inspire new entrants
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The popularity of this relatively new recreational activity will continue inspiring people to open their own local axe throwing center. Established axe throwing centers are likely to continue expanding their business by opening new locations or offering franchises.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Fears of inflation and recession cast doubts over recreational activities
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: If either inflation fears aren't squashed causing hyperinflation or if the Federal Reserve isn't' careful on how it handles its interest rate policies and creates a recession. People standard of living will get even worse than it is currently. Most Americans are barely scraping by, barely making enough to cover the basics needed for living. If the economy gets worse, the last thing most Americans will consider is going out to axe throwing centers.

industry_definition: Operators in the Axe Throwing Centers industry own and operate axe throwing centers.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - increasing

key_trends: Post-pandemic trends help push forward axe throwing center revenue. Increases in per capita disposable income helped push revenue up after the COVID-19 pandemic slashed customer demand.

Pricing will influence how consumers spend limited recreation dollars. Total recreation expenditure is expected to keep growing over the next five years. But, as the cost-of-living crisis continues, many people will be weary of spending their money on a night out and will become more selective on where they go.
The Raise the Wage Act of 2021. This Act looks to raise the national minimum wage to $15.00 per hour by 2025, which affect the wage costs of axe throwing centers.

The Work Opportunity Tax Credit law. Employers get a tax credit for new hires from veterans, ex-felons or summer youth employees. The summer youth employee is essential for amusement and entertainment companies to meet seasonal labor requirements from demand fluctuations.

Customers 44 and younger are increasing as a market. Axe throwing has become a popular recreational activity in this country and for this age demographic who are enjoying a new activity that offers drinking and food.

Large group sessions are the most popular axe throwing center product. Organizations like work or churches believe most of their members will enjoy this event. As axe throwing becomes more popular it is likely this product segment will continue increasing in size.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market consists of customers aged 35 and younger who attend axe throwing centers and throw axes recreationally.
This market consists of customers aged 45 and older who attend axe throwing centers and throw axes recreationally.
This market consists of customers aged 44 and younger who attend axe throwing centers and throw axes recreationally.
This market consists of customers aged 55 and older who attend axe throwing centers and throw axes recreationally.
This market consists of customers aged 65 and older who attend axe throwing centers and throw axes recreationally.
This market consists of customers aged 24 and younger who attend axe throwing centers and throw axes recreationally.

products_and_services.product_description: Large group sessions are axe throwing sessions for large groups of people who are part of an organization or reserved lots of spaces for a particular celebration.
Large group sessions are the most popular axe throwing center product because organizations like work or churches believe most of their members will enjoy this event.
Walk-in sessions consist of people or small groups of people going to an axe throwing center to throw axes without a reservation or for a particular group event.
Food and drinks are food and drinks offered at axe throwing centers for people to enjoy as their throwing axes.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Walk-in sessions consist of people or small groups of people going to an axe throwing center to throw axes without a reservation or for a particular group event.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Are your facilities located in areas with easy access for consumers? Do you have plans to relocate to improve access?
regulations_points.regulation_description: Easy access for clients. A high profile location offering easy access and parking will likely drive consumer demand.

regulations_points.regulation_title: What kind of maintenance is required for your facilities? Have you had any issues regarding maintenance not being properly carried out?
regulations_points.regulation_description: Carrying out all necessary maintenance to keep facilities in good condition. Regular facility maintenance and upkeep is required to ensure customer safety and to extend the life span of equipment.

regulations_points.regulation_title: What kind of equipment is required for your operations? Have you had any difficulty supplying equipment for consumers?

basis_points.basis_description: New entrants often must invest more in marketing expenses to persuade consumers to shift away from existing players with brand recognition.
Rent can be quite high because of strong commercial demand in high-traffic areas.
Price competition affects buyer power. With numerous indoor and outdoor recreational options, price is vital in attracting customers.
Large centers bring a variety of entertainment options in one location, reducing customer travel time.
Population density brings revenue and labor concentration. Since many businesses require a density of customers, revenue and labor is concentrated among the largest companies.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Walk-in sessions as a product are performing strongly
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Walk-in sessions consist of people or small groups of people going to an axe throwing center to throw axes without a reservation or for a particular group event.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Large group sessions are axe throwing sessions for large groups of people who are part of an organization or reserved lots of spaces for a particular celebration.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Food and drinks are a great accoutrement for axe throwing
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Food and drinks are food and drinks offered at axe throwing centers for people to enjoy as their throwing axes.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served my incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Demand is correlated to income and economic fluctuations
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for recreation services increases with growth in per capita disposable income. Over most of the past five years, disposable income levels grew steadily, leading to more individuals and families frequenting recreation establishments with the ability to spend more at each visit.
Many state governments imposed the closure of nonessential businesses. Axe throwing centers were required to shutter temporarily and experienced a crippling loss of revenue.

FAQs.question: Are your facilities located in areas with easy access for consumers? Do you have plans to relocate to improve access?
FAQs.answer: A high profile location offering easy access and parking will likely drive consumer demand.

FAQs.question: What kind of maintenance is required for your facilities? Have you had any issues regarding maintenance not being properly carried out?
FAQs.answer: Regular facility maintenance and upkeep is required to ensure customer safety and to extend the life span of equipment. This will likely help reduce operating costs and increase profit.

FAQs.question: What kind of equipment is required for your operations? Have you had any difficulty supplying equipment for consumers?
FAQs.answer: Having cutting-edge equipment, especially for industry operators, can be a key advantage to expanding revenue and competing with other businesses.

FAQs.question: How is demand for your services affected by the rising popularity of other pastimes? How do you market your services to best reach youth athletes?
FAQs.answer: Consumers are less likely to spend on entertainment options provided by industry operators when they have at-home options.

FAQs.question: How can you cater more specifically to certain age demographics or expand your product offering to cater to plus-size or petite individuals?
FAQs.answer: As growing health consciousness encourages more consumers within this demographic to participate in sports and fitness activities, demand for industry services will likely increase.

FAQs.question: Have you noticed fluctuations in viewership as disposable income has increased? How can you capitalize on growth?
FAQs.answer: As per capita disposable income rises, more consumers will likely be able to allocate expenditures toward leisure activities, including services provided by the Axe Throwing Centers industry.
